destinations.name: Galle
destinations.overview: A historic fortified city on Sri Lanka's southwest coast, famous for its well-preserved Dutch colonial architecture and beautiful beaches.
destinations.description: Galle Fort, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, showcases centuries of colonial history with cobblestone streets, charming cafes, and stunning ocean views.

destinations.name: Polonnaruwa
destinations.overview: Ancient capital of Sri Lanka with magnificent ruins and archaeological treasures, surrounded by wildlife-rich areas.
destinations.description: This medieval capital features well-preserved temples, palaces, and statues that showcase the grandeur of ancient Sri Lankan civilization.

destinations.name: Yala National Park
destinations.overview: Sri Lanka's most famous national park, renowned for having the highest density of leopards in the world.
destinations.description: Spanning 979 square kilometers, Yala offers incredible wildlife viewing opportunities including elephants, sloth bears, crocodiles, and over 215 bird species.

destinations.name: Bentota
destinations.overview: A pristine beach destination perfect for water sports, relaxation, and exploring mangrove ecosystems.
destinations.description: Golden sandy beaches, calm waters, and luxury resorts make Bentota a premier beach destination with excellent water sports facilities.

destinations.name: Kandy
destinations.overview: The cultural capital of Sri Lanka, home to the sacred Temple of the Tooth and surrounded by lush hills.
destinations.description: A UNESCO World Heritage City that was the last capital of the ancient kings' era, famous for its cultural performances and Buddhist heritage.

destinations.name: Ella
destinations.overview: A charming hill country town famous for its stunning viewpoints, waterfalls, and hiking trails.
destinations.description: Nestled in the misty hills, Ella offers breathtaking landscapes, tea plantations, and some of the most Instagram-worthy spots in Sri Lanka.

destinations.name: Anuradhapura
destinations.overview: One of the ancient capitals of Sri Lanka, famous for its well-preserved ruins of ancient Lankan civilization.
destinations.description: A sacred city of Buddhism featuring magnificent dagobas, ancient pools, and the sacred Bodhi tree, showcasing 1,300 years of history.

destinations.name: Sigiriya
destinations.overview: The famous Lion Rock fortress, a UNESCO World Heritage Site with ancient frescoes and stunning panoramic views.
destinations.description: Rising 200 meters from the surrounding plains, this 5th-century sky fortress features remarkable engineering and artistic achievements.

destinations.name: Mirissa
destinations.overview: A tropical beach paradise famous for whale watching, pristine beaches, and vibrant nightlife.
destinations.description: This crescent-shaped beach offers some of the best whale watching opportunities in Asia, along with excellent surfing conditions.

destinations.name: Nuwara Eliya
destinations.overview: Known as 'Little England', this hill station features cool climate, tea plantations, and colonial architecture.
destinations.description: The heart of Sri Lanka's tea country, offering cool mountain air, beautiful gardens, and the famous Ceylon tea experience.

destinations.name: Adam's Peak
destinations.overview: A sacred mountain revered by multiple religions, famous for the 'Sacred Footprint' and sunrise pilgrimage.
destinations.description: Standing at 2,243 meters, this conical mountain attracts pilgrims and hikers who climb during the night to witness the spectacular sunrise.

destinations.name: Kosgoda
destinations.overview: Famous for its turtle conservation project and pristine beaches, perfect for eco-tourism and marine life observation.
destinations.description: Home to five species of sea turtles, this coastal town offers unique opportunities to witness turtle conservation efforts and beautiful beaches.
